There's going to be that transition that might have a few hiccups to it, he said. as encouraging investment. The bitter campaign split Italy's powerful labour unions. Sergio Marchionne praised the "courage" of workers who gave their approval. Saying yes to flexibility makes it possible to achieve very high production levels, of up to 280,000 vehicles per year, and also open the way for the potential creation of jobs, Sergio Marchionne said in a statement. "In a country such as Italy, which has always been tied to the past and reluctant to change... those who voted yes showed vision," he said.
